intro: Streptocalyx seidelii, commonly known as the silverleaf honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Oleaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in a silvery or whitish bloom, giving it its common name. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Streptocalyx seidelii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and pleasant scent.
